Sequence Information.Source: Bombina maxima (Giant fire-bellied toad) (Chinese red belly toad)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.11835991] Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli ATCC 25922 (MIC=19.5 µg/ml), Klebsiella pneumoniae (MIC=9 µg/ml);Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 2592 (MIC=19.5 µg/ml), Bacillus pyocyaneus CMCCB 10104 (MIC=19.5 µg/ml), Bacillus megatherium (MIC=19.5 µg/ml), Bacillus dysenteriae (MIC=2.7 µg/ml);Yeast:Candida albicans ATCC 2002 (MIC=3 µg/ml);Virus:HIV-1 (IC50=15.5 µg/ml, EC50=21.4 µg/ml);Cancer cell lines:C8166 (IC50=15.3 µg/ml), Molt-4 (IC50=24.3 µg/ml), BIU-87 (IC50=20.5 µg/ml), T24 (IC50=35.4 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref:11835991]Little hemolytic activity at 50 μg/ml against red blood cells
Sequence Information.Structure Description: Maximins are linear cationic peptides and easy to form membrane pore and they may induce a detergent-type disruption of sperm membrane like in the case of magainins.
Sequence Information.Function: Antimicrobial activity against Gram-positive, Gram-negative bacteria and fungi. Has little hemolytic activity. Possess a significant cytotoxicity against tumor cell lines. Possess a significant anti-HIV activity. High spermicidal activity.
Sequence Information.Toxic Dose: LD50 is 8.2 mg/kg by intraperitoneal injection into mice.

Literature.Title: Variety of antimicrobial peptides in the Bombina maxima toad and evidence of their rapid diversification.
Literature.Author: Lee WH, Li Y, Lai R, Li S, Zhang Y, Wang W.

Literature.Title: Antimicrobial peptides from skin secretions of Chinese red belly toad Bombina maxima.
Literature.Author: Lai R, Zheng YT, Shen JH, Liu GJ, Liu H, Lee WH, Tang SZ, Zhang Y.
